Ok. So, my Steam library is pretty big. Sort of. I have a total of 12 paid games in my Steam library. The main ones I play are:

- KSP

- Space Engineers

- PAYDAY 2

- Portal 2

- Don't Starve

- And Terraria

Seeing this list of the main games I play on Steam, what would you suggest I get next? I can be either on origin or Steam, but I prefer Steam. I say that, because I am soon to be getting BF3 and BF4 Premium which is dealt through Origin. These main games I enjoy playing too. Especially KSP, Portal and PAYDAY.

My current list of games I am going to get:

- Elite Dangerous

- Craft The World

- Planet Explorers

- GTA San Andreas

- GTA IV

- BF3 Premium

- BF4 Premium

Cheers,

ToTheMun

Edited August 26, 2014 by ToTheMun

Do you have GTA IV? It's a REAL PITA to set up, but it's really fun, the game will last you a while (I'm still playing it, bought it a year ago) it's fairly old too, so should get discounts fairly often.

ive been replaying through dishonored, thats a fun one. skyrim has full workshop support and as such is much more incredible than before. also Chivalry: medieval warfare is my 3rd most played game behind CS:S and KSP

I have been looking a little bit at the entire GTA series. The main thing I am concerned about is if GTA IV and GTA V are online, because I am very rarely near an internet connection that I can use to play online. Most of the time, I am in transit when I play my games. If it has offline compatibility, that will be great though. Then I'll look at getting the entire GTA series. Well, not the entire series, but the good ones at least. Thanks for the recommendations Javster and r4pt0r. Although I don't know dishonoured, I'll have a look at it. And I definitely know of skyrim.

If you like space games I'd recommend Elite Dangerous, the game is David Braben's labour of love, in some ways it's been in creation for 20 years and just looks amazing.

it's still in Beta at the moment but the final release should be soon and there are many features that will be added over time.
